query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 Di pari, come buoi che vanno a giogo, 2 m’andava io con quell’ anima carca, 3 fin che ’l sofferse il dolce pedagogo.
query.error: **English:** 1 Like oxen yoked together, side by side, 2 I journeyed with that soul, weighed down, 3 until the gentle master bore it no longer.
query.result: 1 Yugmena yathā gāvaḥ prayāṇam kurutaḥ, 2 Tathāham api tena ātmānaṃ bhāreṇa yuktāya saha prayāmi sma, 3 Yāvat sa mṛduḥ upādhyāyaḥ tat sahati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
7 dritto sì come andar vuolsi rife’mi 8 con la persona, avvegna che i pensieri 9 mi rimanessero e chinati e scemi.
query.error: **English:** 7 straightway, as he wished to go, I set out 8 with my body, although my thoughts 9 remained behind, bowed down and weakened.
query.result: 7 Yathā gantum icchati, tathā eva śarīreṇa prakramami, 8 Yadyapi mama manaṃśca viṣādaṃ prāptaṃ, 9 Tathāpi naṣṭaṃ durbalam ca abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 Io m’era mosso, e seguia volontieri 11 del mio maestro i passi, e amendue 12 già mostravam com’ eravam leggeri;
query.error: **English:** 10 I had set out, and was following willingly 11 in my master's footsteps, and both of us 12 were already showing how light we were;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 ed el mi disse: «Volgi li occhi in giùe: 14 buon ti sarà, per tranquillar la via, 15 veder lo letto de le piante tue».
query.error: **English:** 13 and he said to me: "Turn your eyes downward: 14 it will be good for you, to make the way easier, 15 to see the bed of your own feet."
query.result: 13 sa ca mama avocat: "Apabhramśaya netrāṇi adhastāt: 14 śreyaḥ te bhaviṣyati, mārgasya śāntikaraṇāya, 15 padayoḥ patanabhūmim paśyan."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Come, perché di lor memoria sia, 17 sovra i sepolti le tombe terragne 18 portan segnato quel ch’elli eran pria,
query.error: **English:** 16 So that their memory may endure, 17 above the buried ones the earthly tombs 18 bear a sign of what they were before,
query.result: 16 Yathā teṣāṃ smṛtiḥ syāt, 17 samādhiṣu upari nihitānāṃ pṛthivīniṣṭhāḥ śilālayaḥ 18 dhārayanti lakṣitaṃ yat te pūrvam āsīt,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
19 onde lì molte volte si ripiagne 20 per la puntura de la rimembranza, 21 che solo a’ pïi dà de le calcagne;
query.error: **English:** 19 so that there one often weeps 20 at the sting of remembrance, 21 which only to the most tender gives way;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
22 sì vid’ io lì, ma di miglior sembianza 23 secondo l’artificio, figurato 24 quanto per via di fuor del monte avanza.
query.error: **English:** 22 thus I saw there, but of better semblance, 23 according to the artistry, depicted 24 as much as projects beyond the mountain's base.
query.result: 22 evam aham tatra adṛkṣam, śreṣṭhatarāyāḥ ākr̥tyāḥ, 23 kalā-kausalena, ālikhitam 24 yāvat parvatasya bāhyeṇa mārgeṇa atiricyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
25 Vedea colui che fu nobil creato 26 più ch’altra creatura, giù dal cielo 27 folgoreggiando scender, da l’un lato.
query.error: **English:** 25 I saw the one who was created noble 26 more than any other creature, come down from heaven 27 thundering, on one side.
query.result: 25 Apaśyam tam yaḥ āsīt uttamaḥ sṛṣṭaḥ 26 Aparebhyaḥ sarvebhyaḥ prajābhyaḥ, adhaḥ svargāt 27 Vidyunmālābhiḥ pradipyamānam, ekasmāt pakṣāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Vedëa Brïareo fitto dal telo 29 celestïal giacer, da l’altra parte, 30 grave a la terra per lo mortal gelo.
query.error: **English:** 28 I saw Briareus, pierced in the body, 29 lying on the celestial side, 30 heavy on the earth because of the mortal cold.
query.result: 28 Apaśyam Briareum naddham śarīreṇa 29 Divye śete, anyasmāt pakṣāt, 30 Guruḥ pṛthivyāṃ martya-hima-nimittam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 Vedea Timbreo, vedea Pallade e Marte, 32 armati ancora, intorno al padre loro, 33 mirar le membra d’i Giganti sparte.
query.error: **English:** 31 I saw Timbreo, I saw Pallas and Mars, 32 still armed, around their father, 33 gazing at the scattered limbs of the Giants.
query.result: 31 Apaśyam Timbreyam, apaśyam Palladeyam ca Marseyam ca, 32 Saśastrāneva, pituḥ paritaḥ, 33 Gigantānāṃ viṣkīrṇāny aṅgāni avalokayantīḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
34 Vedea Nembròt a piè del gran lavoro 35 quasi smarrito, e riguardar le genti 36 che ’n Sennaàr con lui superbi fuoro.
query.error: **English:** 34 I saw Nimrod at the foot of the great work 35 as if bewildered, and gazing at the people 36 who with him in Shinar were presumptuous.
query.result: 34 Apaśyam Nimrodam mahā-kāryasya pāde 35 Yathā vihvalam, paśyantaṃ ca janān 36 Ye Shinaareṇa saha tena durmadaḥ āsīt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 O Nïobè, con che occhi dolenti 38 vedea io te segnata in su la strada, 39 tra sette e sette tuoi figliuoli spenti!
query.error: **English:** 37 O Niobe, with what sorrowful eyes 38 I saw you depicted on the road, 39 between your seven and seven slain children!
query.result: 37 He Nyobe, kena duḥkhitena cakṣuṣā 38 Tvam mārge likhitām adṛkṣam, 39 Sapta sapta tava putrāṇām vināśāt!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 O Saùl, come in su la propria spada 41 quivi parevi morto in Gelboè, 42 che poi non sentì pioggia né rugiada!
query.error: **English:** 40 O Saul, how on your own sword 41 you appeared dead there on Gilboa, 42 which then felt neither rain nor dew!
query.result: 40 He Śaul, kena prakāreṇa tava svakīyāyām khadge 41 Tatrāiva Gelboe mṛtaḥ adṛśyathāḥ, 42 Yasmin paścāt na vṛṣṭiḥ na ca ambuḥ apatat!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
43 O folle Aragne, sì vedea io te 44 già mezza ragna, trista in su li stracci 45 de l’opera che mal per te si fé.
query.error: **English:** 43 O foolish Arachne, I saw you there 44 already half spider, sadly upon the tatters 45 of the work that was ill-done for you.
query.result: 43 He mūḍhe Aragne, tvām adṛkṣam aham tatra 44 Ardha-makṣikām, duḥkhitām tava kṛte duṣṭakarmaṇi 45 Yasya kāryeṇa te duritameva jātam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 O Roboàm, già non par che minacci 47 quivi ’l tuo segno; ma pien di spavento 48 nel porta un carro, sanza ch’altri il cacci.
query.error: **English:** 46 O Rehoboam, it no longer seems that your emblem 47 threatens here; but a chariot bears it, full of fear, 48 without anyone driving it.
query.result: 46 He Rehoboam, atra tava lakṣaṇaṃ naivāvasthitaṃ dṛśyate, 47 kintu bhayena pūrṇo rathaḥ etad dhārayati, 48 anyena anākrāntaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
49 Mostrava ancor lo duro pavimento 50 come Almeon a sua madre fé caro 51 parer lo sventurato addornamento.
query.error: **English:** 49 The hard pavement still showed 50 how dear to Alcmaeon his mother made it seem 51 when he adorned it with the ill-omened ornament.
query.result: 49 Adyāpi kathināṃ bhūmiṃ darśayati 50 Yathā Almeonena svamātṛi kṛtaṃ prītikaraṃ 51 Abharaṇam adṛṣṭaphalam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Mostrava come i figli si gittaro 53 sovra Sennacherìb dentro dal tempio, 54 e come, morto lui, quivi il lasciaro.
query.error: **English:** 52 He showed how the sons threw themselves 53 upon Sennacherib within the temple, 54 and how, after killing him, they left him there.
query.result: 52 Saḥ adarśayat katham putrāḥ apatakṣipanta 53 Sennacheribam abhyantaraṃ mandire, 54 kathañca mṛte tasmin tatra tam atyajanta.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
55 Mostrava la ruina e ’l crudo scempio 56 che fé Tamiri, quando disse a Ciro: 57 «Sangue sitisti, e io di sangue t’empio».
query.error: **English:** 55 It showed the ruin and the cruel slaughter 56 that Tomyris inflicted on Cyrus, when she said to him: 57 "You thirsted for blood, and I fill you with blood."
query.result: 55 Darśayām āsa vināśaṃ ca nṛśaṃsam ca hatyāṃ 56 yāṃ cakāra Tamiriḥ yadā āha Ciro: 57 "Raktaṃ pipāsasi, aham ca raktena tvāṃ pūrayāmi."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Mostrava come in rotta si fuggiro 59 li Assiri, poi che fu morto Oloferne, 60 e anche le reliquie del martiro.
query.error: **English:** 58 It showed how the Assyrians fled in rout 59 after Holofernes was killed, 60 and also the relics of the martyr.
query.result: 58 Pradarśayāmāsa yathā bhagne mārge 59 Asurāḥ palāyante, yadā mṛtaḥ Ūlūpharnaḥ, 60 Tathāpi śeṣāḥ śahīdasya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
61 Vedeva Troia in cenere e in caverne; 62 o Ilïón, come te basso e vile 63 mostrava il segno che lì si discerne!
query.error: **English:** 61 I saw Troy in ashes and in caverns; 62 O Ilium, how base and vile 63 you appeared, as the sign that is discerned there showed!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
64 Qual di pennel fu maestro o di stile 65 che ritraesse l’ombre e ’ tratti ch’ivi 66 mirar farieno uno ingegno sottile?
query.error: **English:** 64 What master of brush or pen 65 could portray the shadows and the forms that there 66 would make a subtle mind marvel?
query.result: 64 Ko vā citrakāraḥ ko vā lekhakaḥ 65 yaḥ ālekhyaṃ kārayet chāyāḥ rūpāṇi ca yāni tatra 66 paśyet kaścid buddhiḥ sūkṣmā?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Morti li morti e i vivi parean vivi: 68 non vide mei di me chi vide il vero, 69 quant’ io calcai, fin che chinato givi.
query.error: **English:** 67 The dead seemed dead and the living seemed alive: 68 no one saw more of the truth than I did, 69 as I trod, until I went down bowed.
query.result: 67 Mr̥tāḥ mr̥tāḥ jīvāḥ jīvā iva āsan: 68 na paśyati adhikaṃ mama yathā satyam paśyati, 69 yāvat aham acarat, yāvat avakrāntaḥ gacchāmi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Or superbite, e via col viso altero, 71 figliuoli d’Eva, e non chinate il volto 72 sì che veggiate il vostro mal sentero!
query.error: **English:** 70 Now go, you proud ones, with haughty face, 71 children of Eve, and do not bow your heads 72 so that you may see your wretched path!
query.result: 70 Atha gacchata, garvam kurvāṇāḥ, mukhena unnatena, 71 he Eve-putrāḥ, na ca namasyata, 72 yathā paśyeta ātmīyam durgamam mārgaṃ!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
73 Più era già per noi del monte vòlto 74 e del cammin del sole assai più speso 75 che non stimava l’animo non sciolto,
query.error: **English:** 73 We had already turned more of the mountain 74 and much more of the sun's path 75 than my unrested mind had reckoned,
query.result: 73 Adhikaḥ asmābhiḥ parvataḥ parivartitaḥ ādau, 74 sūryasya ca gatiḥ atiriktaḥ, 75 yat kalpitaṃ na āsīt acetasaḥ,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
76 quando colui che sempre innanzi atteso 77 andava, cominciò: «Drizza la testa; 78 non è più tempo di gir sì sospeso.
query.error: **English:** 76 when he who always went ahead 77 began to say: "Lift up your head; 78 it is no longer time to go so slowly.
query.result: 76 yadā saḥ yaḥ sadā agre gacchati sma, 77 āha: "Utkṣiptaṃ kuru śiras, 78 na asti adhikaḥ kālaḥ gamanāya evam viṣaṇṇena."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
79 Vedi colà un angel che s’appresta 80 per venir verso noi; vedi che torna 81 dal servigio del dì l’ancella sesta.
query.error: **English:** 79 See there an angel who prepares 80 to come towards us; see that the sixth handmaid 81 returns from the service of the day.
query.result: 79 Paśya tatraikam devam yaḥ samutsukitaḥ 80 asmābhiḥ saha samāgamam kartum; paśya yadi ṣaṣṭhī devī 81 divasya sevayā nivṛttā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
82 Di reverenza il viso e li atti addorna, 83 sì che i diletti lo ’nvïarci in suso; 84 pensa che questo dì mai non raggiorna!».
query.error: **English:** 82 Adorn your face and actions with reverence, 83 so that the delights may draw you upward; 84 think that this day will never dawn again!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 Io era ben del suo ammonir uso 86 pur di non perder tempo, sì che ’n quella 87 materia non potea parlarmi chiuso.
query.error: **English:** 85 I was well accustomed to his admonitions, 86 so as not to waste time, so that in that 87 subject he could not speak to me in riddles.
query.result: 85 Aham api tasya upadeśena abhyastaḥ āsam 86 kālam na nāśayāmi iti, yataḥ tena 87 viṣayena sa mama saṃvṛtaḥ kathitaṃ na śaknoti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
88 A noi venìa la creatura bella, 89 biancovestito e ne la faccia quale 90 par tremolando mattutina stella.
query.error: **English:** 88 Towards us came the beautiful creature, 89 clothed in white, and in her face such 90 that it seemed a trembling morning star.
query.result: 88 A naḥ āgacchat sajjanaḥ sundaraḥ, 89 śuklavastrayuktaḥ, mukhe ca tasya 90 yathā kampamānā prātaḥtārā.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 Le braccia aperse, e indi aperse l’ale; 92 disse: «Venite: qui son presso i gradi, 93 e agevolemente omai si sale.
query.error: **English:** 91 He spread his arms, and then he spread his wings; 92 he said: "Come, here are the steps, 93 and now it is easy to climb.
query.result: 91 Bāhū avatataḥ, tataś ca pakṣau avatataḥ, 92 uvāca: "Āgacchata: atra santi sopānāḥ, 93 atra adhunā saralam ārohaṇam asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 A questo invito vegnon molto radi: 95 o gente umana, per volar sù nata, 96 perché a poco vento così cadi?».
query.error: **English:** 94 To this invitation few respond: 95 O human race, born to fly upward, 96 why do you fall at the slightest breeze?
query.result: 94 Asminn āhvāne na yānti bahu janaḥ: 95 He manusyāḥ, uttamam ārohaṇāya sambhūtāḥ, 96 kimartham alpam vāyum āpnoti eva patanam?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Come a man destra, per salire al monte 101 dove siede la chiesa che soggioga 102 la ben guidata sopra Rubaconte,
query.error: **English:** 100 As a man on the right, to ascend the mountain 101 where sits the church that subjugates 102 the well-guided city above Rubaconte,
query.result: 100 Dakṣiṇabhāge puruṣaḥ, parvatam ārohatum 101 yasminn āsīnaṃ mandirmabhūd yat niyamati 102 Rubaconte-upari suśāsanam puram,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
103 si rompe del montar l’ardita foga 104 per le scalee che si fero ad etade 105 ch’era sicuro il quaderno e la doga;
query.error: **English:** 103 breaks the ardor of climbing 104 by the stairs that were made in an age 105 when the ledger and the cask were secure;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
106 così s’allenta la ripa che cade 107 quivi ben ratta da l’altro girone; 108 ma quinci e quindi l’alta pietra rade.
query.error: **English:** 106 so the bank that falls 107 here is made less steep by the other circle; 108 but on this side and that the high rock scrapes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 Noi volgendo ivi le nostre persone, 110 ‘Beati pauperes spiritu!’ voci 111 cantaron sì, che nol diria sermone.
query.error: **English:** 109 We, turning our persons thither, 110 “Blessed are the poor in spirit!” voices 111 sang so that no speech would tell it.
query.result: 109 Vayam tatra ātmānaḥ pravartayitvā, 110 “Bhagavanto daridrāsya cetasaḥ!” vācaḥ 111 agāyan tāḥ yathā vāṇī na vakṣyati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Ahi quanto son diverse quelle foci 113 da l’infernali! ché quivi per canti 114 s’entra, e là giù per lamenti feroci.
query.error: **English:** 112 Ah, how different are those ditches 113 from the infernal ones! For here one enters 114 with songs, and there below with fierce lamentations.
query.result: 112 Aha katham viśiṣṭāḥ santi tāḥ parikhāḥ 113 narakīyābhyaḥ! Yataḥ atra praviśyate 114 gītair eva, tatra adhastāt tu krūrair vilapaiḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
115 Già montavam su per li scaglion santi, 116 ed esser mi parea troppo più lieve 117 che per lo pian non mi parea davanti.
query.error: **English:** 115 Now I was climbing the holy stairs, 116 and it seemed to me that it was much easier 117 than it had seemed to me on the plain below.
query.result: 115 Tatraiva śubheṣu śreṇīṣu āruhya, 116 Mama atiśayaṃ laghutaram abhavat, 117 Yat pūrvaṃ samatale sthāne mama na abhavat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ond’ io: «Maestro, dì, qual cosa greve 119 levata s’è da me, che nulla quasi 120 per me fatica, andando, si riceve?».
query.error: **English:** 118 Then I said: "Master, tell me, what heavy thing 119 has been lifted from me, that I feel almost 120 no fatigue in walking?"
query.result: 118 Tataśca aham: "He gurudeva, bruhi, kim gurutaraṃ 119 mayā hataṃ, yena mama gamanakāle kim api 120 śramaḥ na bhavati?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 Rispuose: «Quando i P che son rimasi 122 ancor nel volto tuo presso che stinti, 123 saranno, com’ è l’un, del tutto rasi,
query.error: **English:** 121 He replied: "When the P's that are still 122 imprinted on your face have faded almost completely, 123 like the one that is already gone,
query.result: 121 Uvāca: "Yadā P-akṣarāṇi yāni śiṣṭāni 122 adhunikam tava vadane prāyaḥ kṣīṇāni, 123 bhavanti, yathā ekam, samyakṣayitāni,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 fier li tuoi piè dal buon voler sì vinti, 125 che non pur non fatica sentiranno, 126 ma fia diletto loro esser sù pinti».
query.error: **English:** 124 your feet will be so conquered by good will 125 that not only will you not feel fatigue, 126 but it will be a delight for them to be spurred upward."
query.result: 124 tava pādayau śubhābhilāṣeṇaivam jitau bhaviṣyataḥ, 125 yena na kevalam śramaṃ na prāpsyataḥ, 126 api tu tayor ūrddhvam pravṛttau ratiḥ bhaviṣyati."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
127 Allor fec’ io come color che vanno 128 con cosa in capo non da lor saputa, 129 se non che ’ cenni altrui sospecciar fanno;
query.error: **English:** 127 Then I did like those who go 128 with something on their head, not known to them, 129 except that others' signs make them suspect;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
130 per che la mano ad accertar s’aiuta, 131 e cerca e truova e quello officio adempie 132 che non si può fornir per la veduta;
query.error: **English:** 130 so that the hand helps to make sure, 131 and seeks and finds and performs that office 132 which cannot be accomplished by sight;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 e con le dita de la destra scempie 134 trovai pur sei le lettere che ’ncise 135 quel da le chiavi a me sovra le tempie:
query.error: **English:** 133 and with the fingers of my right hand, feeling, 134 I found just six of the letters that he 135 of the keys had incised on my temples:
query.result: 133 dakṣiṇasya hastasya aṅgulibhiḥ sparśayann api 134 ṣaḍ eva akṣarāṇi prāpaṃ yāni akṣarāṇi 135 saḥ kuñjikānāṃ kartā mama śirasi likhitavān:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
136 a che guardando, il mio duca sorrise.
query.error: **English:** 136 at which, looking, my leader smiled.
query.result: 136 tāni paśyan mama netā hasitaḥ.
